etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Royal Microscopical Society. From post-classical Latin rhopalium from ancient Greek ῥόπαλον club + scientific Latin -ium

definitions: In many jellyfishes: any of several small, club-shaped sensory structures (usually four or eight) that project from the margin of the umbrella, typically containing statoliths and ocelli.

notes.text: Rhopalia are characteristic of the classes Scyphozoa and Cubozoa.
